channel.title: tidy data on iplusfour
channel.description: Recent content in tidy data on iplusfour

item.title: COWS! #TidyTuesday
item.description: In this week’s #TidyTuesday screencast I explore some cow facts, using the emojifont package for custom symbols as plot points.

item.title: My first TidyTuesday & screencast!
item.description: Like they say, long journeys start with a single step. This is my first time looking at a #TidyTuesday dataset and my first time doing an R screencast. This week’s data is on incarceration in the US, and in just a short exploration I find some interesting features.

item.title: How to write a data frame to excel without row names in R?
item.description: Got a question today about how to write a data frame to Excel without rownames. Seasoned R vets probably don’t even blink at this, but it’s the type of thing that I think a lot of new users struggle to overcome. Anyhow, here are my quick and simple solutions: The easiest is to write this to a CSV file, which will open in excel. You can use the following code to do this:
